spanishExample: Será un problema; solo tiene dos dólares.
englishTranslation: It’ll be a problem; she only has two dollars.
vocabIncluded: será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tal vez hablen del pasado.
englishTranslation: Perhaps they speak about the past.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hablen: speak, they speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Tenemos que estar aquí por bastante tiempo.
englishTranslation: We have to be here for quite a bit of time.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Tengo un trabajo, pero ellos no quieren que tenga ninguno.
englishTranslation: I have one job, but they don’t want me to have any.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Yo hablaba mientras eso estaba pasando.
englishTranslation: I was talking while that was happening.
vocabIncluded: hablaba: was speaking, I was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Yo paso tiempo aquí y ellos pasan tiempo en fiestas.
englishTranslation: I spend time here and they spend time at parties.
vocabIncluded: pasan: pass, they pass (Pasar, present, 3rd person plural)
paso: pass, I pass (Pasar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Habla conmigo!
englishTranslation: Talk to me!

spanishExample: ¡Hable con cada persona!
englishTranslation: (formal) Talk to each person!

spanishExample: ¡No, estoy hablando!
englishTranslation: No, I’m talking!

spanishExample: ¡Pase! Él hablará con usted en dos minutos.
englishTranslation: (formal) Come in! He’ll talk to you in two minutes.
vocabIncluded: hablará: will speak, he/she/it will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person)
usted: formal "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

spanishExample: ¿Qué tal? ¿Con quién hablas?
englishTranslation: How is it going? Who are you talking to?
vocabIncluded: hablas: speak, you speak (Hablar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿Quieres algo de comida?
englishTranslation: Do you want some food?

spanishExample: Algo pasa con tal cosa.
englishTranslation: Something happens with such a thing.
vocabIncluded: pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Algún hombre tiene que pasar tiempo aquí.
englishTranslation: Some man has to pass time here.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: El equipo no tiene agua y, como tal, tenemos un problema.
englishTranslation: The team doesn’t have water and, as such, we have a problem.

spanishExample: Ella habla con ciertas personas.
englishTranslation: She speaks with certain people.
vocabIncluded: habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hablaba de eso.
englishTranslation: She was talking about that.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaba: was speaking, he/she/it was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hablamos con ellos y alguno de ellos lo hizo.
englishTranslation: We talked to them and one(indefinite) of them did it.
vocabIncluded: hablamos: spoke, we spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Hablamos y pasamos tiempo mientras estamos aquí.
englishTranslation: We speak and pass time while we’re here.
vocabIncluded: hablamos: speak, we speak (Hablar, present, 1st person plural)
pasamos: pass, we pass (Pasar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Hablaré con demasiadas personas.
englishTranslation: I will talk to too many people.
vocabIncluded: hablaré: will speak, I will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Hay cada vez más de esto.
englishTranslation: There is more and more of this.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Hay cada vez menos autos.
englishTranslation: There are less and less cars.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: La luz no pasó por ahí.
englishTranslation: The light didn’t pass through there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
pasó: passed, he/she/it passed (Pasar, preterite, 3rd person)
por to mean “vía/by”, as in "by phone”

spanishExample: Ninguna persona quiere hacerlo y, por tal razón, no podemos hacerlo.
englishTranslation: No person wants to do it and, for such a reason, we can’t do it.
vocabIncluded: por tal razón: "for such a reason" (idiom)

spanishExample: No hables a menos que tengas alguna idea.
englishTranslation: Don’t talk unless you have some idea.

spanishExample: No hay tantas cosas en ese lugar.
englishTranslation: There aren’t so many things at that place.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: No lo hice hasta que hablaste.
englishTranslation: I didn’t do it until you talked.
vocabIncluded: hablaste: spoke, you spoke (Hablar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No quiero que ella pase mucho tiempo en la mesa.
englishTranslation: I don’t want her to spend much time at the table.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pase: pass, he/she/it pass (Pasar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No tenemos suficiente tiempo.
englishTranslation: We don’t have enough time.

spanishExample: Pasará tiempo con él cuando él hable con ella.
englishTranslation: She’ll pass time with him when he talks to her.
vocabIncluded: hable: speak, he/she/it speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
pasará: will pass, he/she/it will pass (Pasar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Pasas tiempo con algunos amigos.
englishTranslation: You spend time with some friends.
vocabIncluded: pasas: pass, you pass (Pasar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Pasé por tu casa hoy.
englishTranslation: I passed by your house today.
vocabIncluded: pasé: passed, I passed (Pasar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Por favor, ¡pasa!
englishTranslation: Please, come in!

spanishExample: Quiere que yo vaya a cualquier otro lugar.
englishTranslation: She wants me to go to any other place.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero tener un poco de tiempo para hacer esto.
englishTranslation: I want to have a little bit of time to do this.
vocabIncluded: para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Quizás ella pase por mi casa.
englishTranslation: Maybe she will pass by my house.
vocabIncluded: pase: pass, he/she/it pass (Pasar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Se quieren, pero no se hablarán.
englishTranslation: They love each other, but they won’t speak to each other.
vocabIncluded: hablarán: will speak, they will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person plural)
nos or se to mean "each other" (idiom)

spanishExample: (Él) es un amigo.
englishTranslation: He is a friend.
